Class Artist

java.lang.Object
problem1.Artist
Direct Known Subclasses:
Musician, Poet, ScreenArtist, VisualArtist
public abstract class Artist extends Object
Abstract base class representing a generic Artist in the Seattle Digital Index.

All artist subtypes share a common identity defined here: name, age, genres, and awards. The receiveAward(String) method provides a shared implementation for appending a new award to the artist's current award list.

This class enforces the invariant that age must be in the range [0, 128]. Subclasses are expected to extend this class and add type-specific fields.

  • Constructor Details

    • Artist

      public Artist(Name name, int age, String[] genres, String[] awards)
      Constructs an Artist with the given name, age, genres, and awards.
      Parameters:
      name - the artist's name (first and last); must not be null
      age - the artist's age; must be in [0, 128]
      genres - the genres this artist works in; must not be null
      awards - the awards this artist has received; must not be null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if age is out of range [0, 128]
      IllegalArgumentException - if name, genres, or awards is null

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public Name getName()
      Returns the artist's name.
      Returns:
      the Name of this artist

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      Returns the artist's age.
      Returns:
      age as an integer in [0, 128]

    • getGenres

      public String[] getGenres()
      Returns a copy of the artist's genres array.
      Returns:
      a defensive copy of the genres array

    • getAwards

      public String[] getAwards()
      Returns a copy of the artist's awards array.
      Returns:
      a defensive copy of the awards array

    • receiveAward

      public void receiveAward(String award)
      Adds a new award to this artist's list of awards.

      A new array is created that contains all existing awards plus the new one appended at the end. The original array is replaced.

      Parameters:
      award - the name of the award to add; must not be null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if award is null

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this artist, including name, age, genres, and awards.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a formatted string describing this artist
